storyInfo: After receiving letters from Professor Bachmann's daughter, Earthspirit finally decides to use a few days of her precious leave to go meet in person. She doesn't want to get into trouble, but finds herself buried in it.

attributes.content: Brr, it's cold.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: All the more reason to knock, instead of wasting time out here.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: But I don't know her that well.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Glad to see you're as shy as ever, even after all these years.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: It still feels weird that we've become colleagues, even after all these years.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Alright, then I guess I'll help you out, as a colleague.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Leithanian Woman

attributes.content: Miss Bachmann, this is Glacier, the 'Earthspirit' whom you wrote to.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Ah, yes. I found a box labeled 'To Glacier' written on it while going through my late mother's belongings, so I asked you to come and pick it up.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: And you're finally here.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: I was on my way to visit family, so I stopped by to see what Professor Bachmann had for me.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Please, come in.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: We pried the box open because we didn't know what was in it. Only after reading the letter inside did we learn it was meant for you.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: We're still not sure what the stuff we found is, though. I wonder if you could tell us.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Hm... a piece of paper and a rock?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: We came all this way for this?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: It's a design for an Arts Unit inhibitor, but still very much in the theoretical stage.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: She taught me how to hear the vibrations of certain minerals using Originium Arts, but all that turned to pure noise after I became Infected.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: At least treatment at Rhodes Island put an end to that. Now I can hear them again, even clearer than before.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: At the time, though, we were at our wits' end. She believed the Oripathy increased my Arts output, so she said she'd make me an inhibitor after I'd worked for a full year.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: An Arts Unit?
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: How hard can it be to order a custom-made Arts Unit in Leithanien? Why did Mom have to do it herself?
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Simply suppressing my Arts would have prevented me from hearing the sounds at all.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: So it could only be made by someone familiar with both the Arts involved and the vibration frequencies of minerals, who could manually calibrate the inhibition of different wavelengthsâ€”like tuning an instrument.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Sounds fascinating. Too bad she never completed it.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: I could still use an inhibitor like that, though... If she'd come this far, perhaps I could continue her research.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: What about the rock then?
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: It's a beacon stone.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Sorry, I'll need more of an explanation than that.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Some rocks undergo metamorphism when they come into contact with Originium, resulting in metamorphic rock that contains Originium.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Such rocks react to my Originium Arts, allowing me to sense them with the help of a tuning fork.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: The professor would use the rocks with the strongest reactions as beacon stones.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: We used to bring them on our field trips, leaving them behind to mark our path.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Wouldn't your beacon stones get mixed up with others using the same method to pass through the same area?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Not many people do this in the first place, and it's even less likely that their stones would use the same frequency. If anything, it would help us identify who else had passed through.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Sounds like a convenient Art.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: It's just about causing small vibrations in matter. Frequency control is a relatively minor part, the key is understanding the mineral composition.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: So why did she leave this to you?
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Perhaps it's a clue, a way of asking me to use my Arts to search the city for this beacon's frequency.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Is that okay with you, Parker?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Should be fine, as long as it doesn't endanger public safety, or draw the attention of others.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: I sense a trail leading outside the city.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Should we check it out?
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Now?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: If not now, when? You're leaving tomorrow, aren't you?
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: I could always come back another time.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: And Professor Bachmann always told me that curiosity leads to ruin.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: This is a nomadic city, you know. You may not be able to pick up the trail next time, if it's outside the city.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: I'm here on vacation, not for work.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: This isn't exactly work, is it? Whatever you find belongs to you. Walk a few steps, make some easy money.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: We have time, Earthspirit. I just heard from the hotel that it's going to be a couple of hours before they get the room ready anyway.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: They sure are sloppy...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Alright, we'll go and try to get this done before dark.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Never thought I'd see a place like this outside the city.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Are you sure it's here?
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Yes, this is where the signal led.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Hm... a cave with a tunnel leading beyond. The entrance has caved in.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Huh? Is this mine what mom left you?
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: It seems to have been abandoned long ago. And I'm not aware of her owning any private mines.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: The signal goes further in.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: It's beneath the cave-in.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Beneath? We should have brought tools.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Leave it to me.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Earthspirit touches the ground with the end of her staff, and the collapsed area begins to liquefy.
Then, the ground begin to roil.
Soon, an elaborate metal box rises to the surface.
There must be something valuable inside!
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: That's good news.
Hey, what are you doing?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Thanks for the heads-up. Now I can get my hands on the full legacy of Professor Bachmann.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Miss Bachmann?! Was this a trap?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Sorry. I wish there was another way, but my husband insists that we tie up all loose ends.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: We can leave once we sell these, right honey? We can live a better life in Columbia, like you said?
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Ngh!
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Her leg? Where are you aiming? Shoot to kill, not maim.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: What are you doing? Are you out of your mind?!
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: You have no idea how much time and effort I spent planning this.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: But Bachmann left behind little beyond a house and a bunch of useless rocks.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: And now that I have my hands on the last remaining piece of the inheritance, I don't need you. I'd rather not have to split the spoils.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: This will give me the capital I need to make a comeback in the Columbian mining sector.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Just look at this. An abandoned mine outside the nomadic city. An opportunity of a lifetime.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Stop this!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: My dear Miss Glacier, I hear you've turned down invitations from multiple Rim Billiton companies.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Join me, and I'll allow you to live and serve me. I'll even give you a leadership position.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Sorry, I'm not looking for a career change. The pay may be nothing to write home about, but working for Rhodes Island has many perks for an Infected.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Have you never thought about escaping the cage of everyday life?
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: About a vacation, where you don't have to worry about when you'll return to work.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: About having time to just lie in bed, without needing to think about anything.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Don't you want to live a life like that?
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Who doesn't?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Then join me. You'll have authority, and plenty of vacation time.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: You said the same thing to Miss Bachmann, didn't you?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I'll admit your words may be tempting to the young.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: But I've been around long enough to know that jobs like that simply don't exist. Anything offering such great conditions is probably a scam.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Still, sparing your life was part of that offer. You would be wise not to defy me.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: It's bothersome enough keeping track of my boss' condition at Rhodes Island. I took leave for New Year's, and I'd rather spend it on my own projects, thank you very much.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: It hurts... Ugh...
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Oh, shut up.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Kill her first!
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Want us to shoot her?
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: With your aim? No need to prolong her misery, just get it over with.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Draw your swords!
attributes.name: Mercenary Captain

attributes.content: Hey, I can't move! Something's grabbing my feet!
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: No, you're sinking!
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: You shall not pass.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Help! It's up to my chest! I can't breathe!
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: Grab my hand!
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: Damn it!
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: We can't get through!
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: Is this your final answer, Glacier?
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Take it however you'd like.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I changed my mind. Kill all three of them.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Wait, I haven'tâ€”
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Switch to crossbows. Shoot them from a distance!
attributes.name: Mercenary Captain

attributes.content: Yes, sir!
attributes.name: Mercenary B

attributes.content: Target the Caprinae! Kill her and stop her Arts!
attributes.name: Mercenary Captain

attributes.content: You're not hurting my colleague.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Oh, forgot about you.
attributes.name: Mercenary Captain

attributes.content: Captain, this place is too cramped. They could easily block all our bolts with that shield, and the Caprinae's Arts are preventing us from closing in.
attributes.name: Mercenary A

attributes.content: What a pain...
attributes.name: Mercenary Captain

attributes.content: I'm not paying you to stand around! Do something!
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Mercenary Captain

attributes.content: How about this? Explosive bolts we found at the cave entrance!
attributes.name: Mercenary Captain

attributes.content: Not gonna happen!
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: What? They're aiming above our heads?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Cause of death: cave-in due to disrepair. What a perfect conclusion!
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Watch outâ€”
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Miss Bachmann looks up and sees only a great mass of black.
A tire-sized rock falls towards her.
Before she has finished processing what is going on, a white hand enters her field of vision.
Rocks turn to sand when they touch it, and flow through the gaps in its fingers onto her cheeks, still warm from the hand's touch.
She sees a Caprinae grabbing her shoulder with one hand, the other hand raised high in the air.
She smells a familiar scent of dirt and grass, just like that of her mother.
A sense of security surrounds her, one that she had forgotten for close to twenty years.
Are you okay?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Thank you... you could do that?
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: It only took a few calculations.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Glad I wasn't late this time.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: They're aiming deeper!
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: The whole place is coming down!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Are they trying to bury us alive?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Get over here, Parker!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I think we should run!
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: She can't walk! And those guys have blocked the way!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Well, we can't just sit here on our thumbs!
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Just trust me!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Wait, Earthspirit!
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Stop! The warning light on your monitoring ring has turned red!
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: A false positive.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Are those... bones?
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Don't look.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Stick close!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Hahaha! Die!
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: At first, the rocks turn into sand of various colors, like stars falling from the sky.
The grains gradually increase in size, hitting the ground like the spring rain.
The rocks at a distance also begin to fall, hitting the ground hard.
Rather than swallowing the three of them up, the liquefied ground rises like the tide and lifts them.
Earthspirit?!
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: I'm fine, just calibrating things! Cover your nose and mouth, and don't let any dust get into your body, or you'll be making a lot of trips to the doctor!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: You're analyzing the composition of each falling rock and each inch of earth, and vibrating them at different frequencies? And you call that 'a few calculations'?
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: If anything goes wrong...
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: W-What's going on?
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: She can't move right now! Shoot! Shoot her!
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Oh no!
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Not so fast.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: The falling dust suddenly turns back into stone, blocking the incoming bolts as they fall.
As they hit the ground, they send forth ripples, as though falling into water, which build into waves that surge towards the cave entrance.
And as those waves come into contact with the people standing there, the liquefied earth returns to normal.
Iâ€”I can't move!
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Tie them up, Parker, and call the police.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Wait! Did you think she was innocent?
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Forging the will, stealing the inheritanceâ€”she was my accomplice from beginning to end.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: It was her idea to use you to find the final legacy!
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Forging the will and stealing the inheritance?!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Why did you do that, Miss Bachmann?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: You never realized? Mom never loved me. She only ever had eyes for my brother.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: I never got anything from her... so it's only fair that I get a bigger slice of the inheritance.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: What on Terra are you talking about?! Do you realize what you did? You were plotting with that guy to exploit me just minutes ago!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Mom did so much for you, it's the least you could do to help me escape this hell!
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: I wasn't going to take your life...
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Look, I'm a recent graduate, and I've been all over the place looking for a job. But with this money, I wouldn't have to work at all; I could sleep-in all day if I wanted to.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: ...You're a spoiled brat.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: What do you know? You only visit home once a year. Adults like you only care about work, never about your family. You deserve to drown in the endless cycle of mundane life.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: I'm not in a position to defend the image you have of Professor Bachmann.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: But you have no right to criticize me, or anyone who works hard and lives their lives seriously!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Yes, I'm a jerk who hardly ever goes home.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Besides my work at Rhodes Island, I also accept jobs as a Catastrophe Messenger to make some extra cash.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Do you know why?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Did you think I do it just so I don't have to go home? Do you think anyone LIKES living like that?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I was born and raised outside the nomadic cities, in a tiny town with nothing.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: That's what I consider home, and it never moves. It's not so bad when there's a nomadic city nearby, but they're never around forever, and they always leave us behind.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: What will my family do when a Catastrophe comes, if I don't make enough money for them to move to a nomadic city?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I may be a Catastrophe Messenger, but that doesn't mean I have a solution other than paying to get them out of harm's way.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Maybe you think you could live without a care, unlike the rest of us. But if you don't care about the deeper issue, then at least spare me your juvenile sense of superiority!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I worked for this inheritance!
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Would you have gotten any of it without me? Even your Leonard here's been working harder than you.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Actually, it's Louisâ€”
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: Shut up! I don't care what your name is!
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: The normally quiet Caprinae roars.
But the collapsed cave walls do not echo her voice.
Even the skulking skeletal creature behind her whimpers and backs off.
...Yes, ma'am.
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: ...Huff...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: As far as I know, Miss Bachmann, your mother loved you.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: She worked four jobsâ€”professor, geologist, Catastrophe Messenger, and pianistâ€”because she loved you and wanted you to have a better life.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Your older brother suffered from malnutrition as a child, leading to all sorts of complications, and she was worried that you'd end up like him.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: She gave you a comfortable life, and the best education money can buy in Leithanien, but also your current... immaturity...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: So what? You say she gave me all that, but was hardly ever home. She wasn't so busy that she couldn't take a single day off, was she?
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: One time, she wanted to take some time off and spend it with you.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: But then I slipped and fell in a cave during some fieldwork.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: She said I was in bad shape, covered in cuts from the exposed Originium.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: She had to patch me up and drive me all the way to Rhodes Island. So... it was my fault.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: If she'd gone home back then, and you talked out your feelings together, then perhaps she'd have retired earlier, and things could have gone differently.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: This is my fault. My curiosity was the cause of all this.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Just like she taught me: curiosity leads to ruin.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: If you know it's your fault, then leave me alone, and let me live my life!
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: But this man will throw you under the bus the moment I hand him over to the police. You want me to let him go too?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: He's got a criminal record; I had to get someone smuggle him into the city. Destroy his fake documents, and they won't let him in.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: That's the best way to get rid of him.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: You... you backstabbing bitch!
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: You betrayed me first!
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: You'd be dead already if I could move!
attributes.name: Louis

attributes.content: So, are you asking me to make the decision?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: You said you were sorry, right? Then let me live my life.
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: I'm sorry... Miss Bachmann.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Making decisions is for leaders. I just do the job I'm paid for.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Besides, you dragged me into your family matters while I'm on vacation. Can you pay me overtime?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: What?! You dirty, stinking Infected...
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: I'll take you to the hospital to get your wounds treated, and then ask your brother what he thinks. If he's okay with it, things can stay as they are.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: If not, then it's off to the courts.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: You'll ruin my life!
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Maybe you ruined it all on your own.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Let's split up, Parker. We'll meet up in front of the Bachmann home once we're done.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Wait!
attributes.name: Miss Bachmann

attributes.content: Understood.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Everything's taken care of on my end.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Didn't think I'd ever see you lose control like that.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Ahem. I never lost control...
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: It was just... let's call it stress relief.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: What are you looking at?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Their house. The last time I was here, the plants in the garden were trimmed, and the walls were neat and clean. How did it get so run down in just a few years?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Professor Bachmann worked so hard to support her family, and for what?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I guess you should spend more time with them when you're the head of the household.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Now explain the monitoring ring, Earthspirit. Under normal circumstances, I'd be required to report that to the HQ immediately.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Did you see that thing behind me?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Just a faint silhouette. Was it a living thing?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Yes. Not everyone can see it, but it gets clearer when I cast Originium Arts. It should've been fairly visible back there.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: My Arts depend on accurate control of the output. Most vibrations only require a small amount of energy, and the rest goes to waste.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: And since only a little bit of it is used, the excess gets radiated.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: At some point it began to draw in creatures like that, which feed on the waste energy.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: And with the help of the Casters at Rhodes Island, I discovered how to draw upon the energy contained inside it.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: But that causes a direct flowback into my body.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Which is why the warning light on the monitoring ring lit up.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: So there's no need to worry, but we'll need to do something about the data. I don't want to be put on medical leave if the Doctor or Kal'tsit finds out.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Understood.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: You've never been a good liar, so I'll believe you.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Thanks, Parker.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Oh? Sounds like you had quite the adventure over your vacation.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Too much adventure for me, I'm afraid. I took a detour to see Professor Bachmann's daughter, but I never imagined the trouble that'd bring me.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Don't eat so much fried food. Here, have some veggies.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: But a little bit now and then improves my mood. Want some fries?
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: I guess that means your mood needs improving?
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Don't push yourself too hard, okay? But no, I don't even know how you can stomach those cold, soggy things.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: So, what was in the box?
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Geological units collected from north of Ursus.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Sounds like things are about to get busy for you.
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: Not really. The professor said these came from unexplored lands. We may not get a chance to visit there in our lifetimes.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: She always said she'd leave them to me someday, but I didn't expect her to already have made the preparations.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Isn't it hard for researchers like you to keep your curiosity in check?
attributes.name: Provence

attributes.content: I still have a lot of hobbies. I get to do what I like after work, rather than worrying about what needs my attention.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Besides, I made a promise to the professor.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: My job is just to keep these safe, and report to Kal'tsit and the Doctor. Nothing more, nothing less.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: ...I just remembered that I still haven't made my report.
attributes.name: Earthspirit

attributes.content: Ugh... looks like another rough afternoon.
attributes.name: Earthspirit
